00001 # Tweepy

00004 
00005 from tweepy.models import ModelFactory
00006 from tweepy.utils import import_simplejson
00007 from tweepy.error import TweepError
00008 
00009 
00010 class Parser(object):
00011 
00012     def parse(self, method, payload):
00013         """
00014         Parse the response payload and return the result.
00015         Returns a tuple that contains the result data and the cursors
00016         (or None if not present).
00017         """
00018         raise NotImplementedError
00019 
00020     def parse_error(self, payload):
00021         """
00022         Parse the error message from payload.
00023         If unable to parse the message, throw an exception
00024         and default error message will be used.
00025         """
00026         raise NotImplementedError
00027 
00028 
00029 class RawParser(Parser):
00030 
00031     def __init__(self):
00032         pass
00033 
00034     def parse(self, method, payload):
00035         return payload
00036 
00037     def parse_error(self, payload):
00038         return payload
00039 
00040 
00041 class JSONParser(Parser):
00042 
00043     payload_format = 'json'
00044 
00045     def __init__(self):
00046         self.json_lib = import_simplejson()
00047 
00048     def parse(self, method, payload):
00049         try:
00050             json = self.json_lib.loads(payload)
00051         except Exception, e:
00052             raise TweepError('Failed to parse JSON payload: %s' % e)
00053 
00054         needsCursors = method.parameters.has_key('cursor')
00055         if needsCursors and isinstance(json, dict) and 'previous_cursor' in json and 'next_cursor' in json:
00056             cursors = json['previous_cursor'], json['next_cursor']
00057             return json, cursors
00058         else:
00059             return json
00060 
00061     def parse_error(self, payload):
00062         error = self.json_lib.loads(payload)
00063         if error.has_key('error'):
00064             return error['error']
00065         else:
00066             return error['errors']
00067 
00068 
00069 class ModelParser(JSONParser):
00070 
00071     def __init__(self, model_factory=None):
00072         JSONParser.__init__(self)
00073         self.model_factory = model_factory or ModelFactory
00074 
00075     def parse(self, method, payload):
00076         try:
00077             if method.payload_type is None: return
00078             model = getattr(self.model_factory, method.payload_type)
00079         except AttributeError:
00080             raise TweepError('No model for this payload type: %s' % method.payload_type)
00081 
00082         json = JSONParser.parse(self, method, payload)
00083         if isinstance(json, tuple):
00084             json, cursors = json
00085         else:
00086             cursors = None
00087 
00088         if method.payload_list:
00089             result = model.parse_list(method.api, json)
00090         else:
00091             result = model.parse(method.api, json)
00092 
00093         if cursors:
00094             return result, cursors
00095         else:
00096             return result
